recommendations: LinkedIn User “It was a pleasure having known & worked alongside Anshika during our time together at Ditto. Three interesting observations about this young woman is all you need to know about her commitment & work ethics: 1. Anshika, was always on my list of colleagues whose quality of deliverables was good! Never has there been a time where I could turn back to say that her work disappointed the team. 2. This young woman definitely needs applause for her confidence, ability to hold good conversations at work & the level of diligence she maintained at Ditto. Its not something common to witness among young people at work, its a rare quality that Anshika has and I only hope she builds upon her strengths in the years to come. 3. “Dependable”, colleagues who are dependable to me are the ones who communicate well (esp. in remote roles), who follow up diligently and who take up accountability end-to-end. And Anshika definitely ticked that box for me. I am very sure this young lady is going to do wonders in the years ahead of her & I am going to be on the stands cheering for her. Thanks a lot Anshika for the good company during our time at Ditto and all the very best for the road ahead.”

Rohit Ojha “Anshika has consistently been one of the top performers and has shown the ability to manage multiple projects and work on her responsibilities with utmost efficiency. She has great product knowledge and has been one of my go to people for the same.”

honors_and_awards.title: 4th Prize in National Consulting Olympiad
honors_and_awards.description: National Consulting Olympiad By Business Prodigy’s Rank: 4/113

honors_and_awards.title: Global Finalist
honors_and_awards.description: A Global Consulting Ideathon- "Just in Case" was organised by DDUC including participation from HEC-Paris, UNSW-Sydney, ISB, IIM- B, IIM-L and more. The case competition required a critical analysis of Boeing and its downfall. 3 key areas to focus on were: - A Crisis Management plan. - Evaluation of its Portfolio. - Study of its Financials and Corporate Governance.

honors_and_awards.title: National Finalist
honors_and_awards.description: A case study competition on the theme of Viksit Bharat @ 2047. Objective: To analyse and evaluate 3 key events in the Indian Economy- 1. Why did India undergo a period of sluggish economic growth until 1991? 2. Implementation of Washington Consensus for the growth of the Economy. 3. India’s current strong position in the global economy.

honors_and_awards.description: 120+ students participated in the event wherein everyone had to set up a stall in the annual fest. The students were judged on the basis of the uniqueness of the product, marketing strategy, profits, presentation and communication skills.
